THE JOHNS HOPKINS NEWS-LETTER, FEBRUARY 20. 1925
RIFLE TEAM WINS FIRST
MATCH IN I. R. A.
MEET
Inter-Company Match to Be Held at
End of Coming Month; Waring
Leaves Town

The Johns Hopkins Rifle Team
-aptured the first match in the I.
R. A. meet by beating Gettysburg.
The contest was in all four positions, with .ten men competing but
only the five highest scores counting. The results of the other
matches in the league were, as follows: George Washington UniverSity, 1904, beat University of Pittsburgh, 1875; Georgetown, 1906,
heat Carnegie, 1801; St. John's,
1733, beat Lafayette, 1675; Johns
Hopkins, 1866, beat Gettysburg,
1796. An analysis of the scores
clearly shows that Johns Hopkins
has an excellent chance of winning the met, if a slight increase
in scores is made.
Georgetown First Foe

On Saturday, February 21, the
first shoulder-to-shoulder match of
the year will be held with Georgetown at home. It will conSist of all
four positions, five men competing,
and all scores to count. On the Saturday following, there will be a
shoulder-to-shoulder match with
St. John's, at home, under the
same conditions. .
To encourage interest in rifle
shooting in the University, the annual Inter-Company Rifle Match
is to be held at the end of the coming month. Major Hoisington has
set March 30 as the opening day,
and 2 P. M. of April 2, as the time
limit. Each company commander
will by March 25, submit a list of
ten men who have not taken part
in any match, as a representative
of the Rifle Team.

Juniors Fail to Elect Treasurer, But
Pick Eight Best Known Men
in Class

The Sophomore and Junior
Classes both held important business meetings last Monday during the noon hour. The Sophomore Class at its meeting provided for the annual class banquet.
The Juniors tried to elect a Class
Treasurer, find the eight most
prominent men in the class, and
hear the report of the Class Prom
Committee.

THE JOHNS HOPKINS NEWS-LETTER, FEBRUARY 20. 1925
RIFLE TEAM WINS FIRST
MATCH IN I. R. A.
MEET
Inter-Company Match to Be Held at
End of Coming Month; Waring
Leaves Town

The Johns Hopkins Rifle Team
-aptured the first match in the I.
R. A. meet by beating Gettysburg.
The contest was in all four positions, with .ten men competing but
only the five highest scores counting. The results of the other
matches in the league were, as follows: George Washington UniverSity, 1904, beat University of Pittsburgh, 1875; Georgetown, 1906,
heat Carnegie, 1801; St. John's,
1733, beat Lafayette, 1675; Johns
Hopkins, 1866, beat Gettysburg,
1796. An analysis of the scores
clearly shows that Johns Hopkins
has an excellent chance of winning the met, if a slight increase
in scores is made.
Georgetown First Foe

On Saturday, February 21, the
first shoulder-to-shoulder match of
the year will be held with Georgetown at home. It will conSist of all
four positions, five men competing,
and all scores to count. On the Saturday following, there will be a
shoulder-to-shoulder match with
St. John's, at home, under the
same conditions. .
To encourage interest in rifle
shooting in the University, the annual Inter-Company Rifle Match
is to be held at the end of the coming month. Major Hoisington has
set March 30 as the opening day,
and 2 P. M. of April 2, as the time
limit. Each company commander
will by March 25, submit a list of
ten men who have not taken part
in any match, as a representative
of the Rifle Team.
